intro: Duvernoia curviflora, commonly known as the curved-flower duvernoia, is a rare and ancient plant species belonging to the family Ginkgoales. It is characterized by its distinctive, fan-shaped leaves that are often divided into segments, giving it a unique appearance. The plant is native to China and is considered a relict species, surviving from the Mesozoic era. Its botanical features include a single trunk with a crown of foliage, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is listed as endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
